conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true cutaway/isometric 3D model with extruded walls (height + thickness), visible floor plane, and roof/ceiling removed to expose interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall corners, clear interior volume, and clean cutaway; only minor simplification of some wall/edge detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room layout matches the 2D plan (kitchen/dining left, living central/top, two bedrooms right, bath central/right, hall central, laundry/closet bottom-left). Minor proportional deviations and a few opening/partition placements appear slightly shifted/simplified vs the plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present: dining set, kitchen run, living seating/table, beds, bathroom fixtures. Placement largely consistent with inferred room identities; slight simplification of some utility/closet detailing.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear and readable with consistent materials and good visibility; some mild visual complexity/overlap from door-swing graphics and similar wall colors reduces immediate legibility.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion drift: a few partitions and room dimensions (notably around hall/bath/closet region) look slightly adjusted/simplified compared to the 2D plan.
Some doors/windows/openings appear simplified and may not perfectly match exact 2D positions/sizes, though overall placement is directionally consistent on exterior and key interior walls.

summary: A true, clean cutaway 3D conversion that preserves the plan’s overall room arrangement and furnishings with only minor proportional and opening-placement simplifications.
